1.instruction: Enhance the existing Lost & Found AI system at /workspace/src/ by adding a comprehensive admin panel for claims management. Key requirements: 1) Create a dedicated Claims Management interface where admins can view, filter, and manage all lost/found item claims, 2) Add claim status tracking (pending, verified, matched, closed, disputed), 3) Implement bulk actions for claim approval/rejection, 4) Add detailed claim information views with user contact details and item verification, 5) Create claim matching suggestions with AI confidence scores, 6) Add dispute resolution workflow for conflicting claims, 7) Implement admin notifications for urgent claims and matches, 8) Add claims analytics dashboard with success rates and processing times, 9) Create export functionality for claims data and reports, 10) Add user management features for blocking/unblocking users and managing permissions. Use React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui components. Ensure the admin panel integrates seamlessly with the existing auto-learning system.

2.instruction: Design a comprehensive system architecture for the enhanced Lost & Found AI system with auto-learning capabilities based on Emma's PRD at /workspace/docs/design/prd.md. The system design should include: 1) Auto-learning module architecture with YOLOv8m-cls integration, 2) Database schema for retraining datasets and metadata management, 3) FAISS/Milvus vector database design for similarity search, 4) Background scheduler architecture using APScheduler, 5) Feedback loop system design, 6) Model optimization pipeline with incremental learning, 7) API endpoints for all new functionalities, 8) Data flow diagrams showing the complete learning cycle, 9) Security considerations for model updates, 10) Scalability architecture for handling large datasets. Output the system design document with detailed technical specifications.

3.instruction: Implement the enhanced Lost & Found AI system with auto-learning capabilities based on Bob's system design at /workspace/docs/design/system_design.md and Emma's PRD. Key implementations required: 1) Upgrade the existing React frontend to include feedback UI components for user confirmations and corrections, 2) Implement mock auto-learning service with YOLOv8m-cls simulation, 3) Create dataset management system for storing and organizing verified samples, 4) Build similarity search with hierarchical comparison (class-first then broader search), 5) Implement feedback collection and verification system, 6) Create background scheduler simulation for auto-retraining triggers, 7) Add model optimization interface with incremental learning simulation, 8) Build comprehensive admin dashboard for monitoring learning progress, 9) Implement embedding regeneration and index rebuilding simulation, 10) Create system documentation and architecture flow diagram. Use React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui components. Ensure the system demonstrates the complete auto-learning workflow even with simulated backend services.
